_header: Lo he that can be Christs clerk
_description: Against the Lollards — 152 lines in 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc) with refrain: ‘Defende us all fro Lollardie’

BLCottVesBXVI.First Lines:
Lo he þat can be cristes clerc / And knowe þe knottes of his
                    credeNow may se a wonder werke / of harde happes to take good
                    heede…
BLCottVesBXVI.Last Lines:
…þan double deth for suych lollynges / is heuy when we shhul
                    hennes hyeNow lord þat madest of nouȝt all thinges / defende vs
                    all fro lollardie
BLCottVesBXVI.Note:
19 eight-line stanzas, ababcdcd. Written two lines per manuscript line
                    in this MS, the line break marked by virgule.
